resource.name: High Cost Disbursements
resource.description: This dataset provides information about total dollars disbursed to Eligible Telecommunication Carriers (ETCs) within the High Cost Program by month and year since January 2003.
columns_description: State abbreviation for carrier receiving High Cost support.
Individual High Cost fund in which the carrier participates. See High Cost Funds Glossary for details.
FCC Form 498 ID (also called a Service Provider Identification Number or SPIN) is a unique nine-digit number assigned to a service provider by USAC when the service provider files an FCC Form 498.
Unique number assigned to each ETC based on its service area. A carrier with multiple service areas within a single state will have multiple SAC.
Standard name used to identify a study area. Typically, the study area name is the same as the carrier name.
Month of disbursement to carrier.
Amount of funding disbursed to carriers. The “amount disbursed” may occasionally show a negative number. This is a result of prior period adjustments, audit recoveries, or other factors.
Year of disbursement to carrier.

domain_tags: connect america fund broadband loop support
connect america fund phase ii auction

domain_metadata.value: This dataset provides information about total dollars disbursed to Eligible Telecommunication Carriers (ETCs) within the High Cost Program by month and year since January 2003. Use this dataset to answer questions such as: What disbursements has an ETC received from USAC? What type of High Cost support does each state receive?

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 to 100 percent. Any value less than 100 percent indicates a field with missing values.

resource.name: Lifeline Companies Near Me
resource.description: This dataset provides the information of all the carriers providing Lifeline and Affordable Connectivity Program (ACP) service, their customer service number, service type, state, and URL. The purpose of this dataset is to provide the most accurate list of carriers providing service in a particular area within a given state, through the use of zip codes. To ensure that this data is up-to-date and accurate, it is refreshed periodically to add new carriers and the corresponding zip codes of their designated service areas, update the zip codes for existing carriers, and remove zip codes for carriers that have relinquished their ETC designation. In the event that a user enters a zip code that does not return any service provider(s), a complete listing of the state in which the zip code is found will be returned with the recommendation that the consumer confirm the availability of Lifeline or ACP service in their chosen zip code with a service provider from that state.
columns_description: URL of the carrier’s website.
Zip code of the area where the carrier provides service.
Full legal name of the carrier.
Customer service phone number of the carrier.

Type of service provided by the carrier. It may be wireless or wireline for service offered through the Lifeline Program. It may be ACP Home Internet or ACP Mobile Internet for service offered through the ACP.

Eligible households can also receive a one-time discount of up to $100 to purchase a laptop, desktop computer, or tablet from participating providers if they contribute more than $10 and less than $50 toward the purchase price.
County of the area where the carrier provides service.
State where a Study Area Code (SAC) is designated.
City of the area where the carrier provides service.
A provider offers one or more plans that are covered in full by the ACP discount and by choosing one of those plans your monthly cost for service is $0.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset provides the information of all the carriers providing Lifeline service, their customer service number, service type, state, and URL for a particular zip code. The purpose of this dataset is to provide the most accurate list of carriers providing service in a particular area within a given state, through the use of zip codes. To ensure that this data is up-to-date and accurate, it is refreshed periodically to add new carriers and the corresponding zip codes of their designated service areas, update the zip codes for existing carriers, and remove zip codes for carriers that have relinquished their ETC designation. In the event that a user enters a zip code that does not return any service provider(s), a complete listing of the state in which the zip code is found will be returned with the recommendation that the consumer confirm the availability of Lifeline in their chosen zip code with a service provider from that state.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset is then noted with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0% to 100%. Any metric less than 100% means that users left certain fields blank when reporting the information to USAC.

resource.name: E-Rate Open Competitive Bidding: Basic Information (FCC Form 470 and Related Information)
resource.description: This dataset contains information from the basic information section of each FCC Form 470, including applicant details such as contact information, application number, Billed Entity Number (BEN), and funding year, and related information from the E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC).
columns_description: Email address of the technical contact provided by the applicant of the FCC Form 470.
Name of the person authorized to certify the FCC Form 470.
Address of the person authorized to certify the FCC Form 470.
City of the person authorized to certify the FCC Form 470.
State of the person authorized to certify the FCC Form 470.
Applicant zip code extension.
Applicant zip code.
Unique billed entity number (BEN) associated with the entity name on the FCC Form 470.
Name of the person who created the FCC Form 470.
Name of the person who last modified the FCC Form 470.
Exact date and time the FCC Form 470 was last modified (EST).
The person who certified the FCC Form 470.
Exact date and time the FCC Form 470 was certified (EST).
Applicant state.
Applicant city.
Applicant street address line 2.
Applicant street address line 1.
Unique 10-digit number assigned by the FCC to a business or individual that registers with the FCC.
Longitude of the applicant.
Zip code of the person authorized to certify the FCC Form 470.
Zip code extension of the person authorized to certify the FCC Form 470.
Phone number of the person authorized to certify the FCC Form 470.
Website for the billed entity.
Applicant type including: school, school district, library, library system, or consortium.
The type of the entity including school district, school, library system, library, consortium, and non-instructional facility (NIF).
Phone extension of the person authorized to certify the FCC Form 470.
Email address of the person authorized to certify the FCC Form 470.
Title of the person authorized to certify the FCC Form 470.
Employer of the person authorized to certify the FCC Form 470.
Exact date and time the FCC Form 470 was created (EST).

Earliest date on which an applicant can sign a contract for contracted services or enter into an arrangement for tariffed (T) or month to-month (MTM) services with a service provider is 28 days after the certified date.
Current status of the FCC Form 470.
Funding year for the FCC Form 470.
Applicant email address.
Latitude of the applicant.
Indicates if the organization is active (open) or closed.
Name of the billed entity.
Unique application number generated at the time applicants begin to file the FCC Form 470. Applicants can request funding for multiple services under the same application number.
Nickname given to an application by an applicant when filling their FCC Form 470.
Link to download the original submitted FCC Form 470 as a PDF.

Indicates whether the form version of the application is "current" or "original." It can be used to aggregate the data between current and original applications. "Current" is the view of the form processed by USAC. "Original" is the view of the form originally submitted by the applicant upon certification.
Indicates that all libraries in the state are included for the FCC Form 470.
Indicates that all non-public schools in the state are included for the FCC Form 470.
Indicates that all public schools/districts in the state are included for the FCC Form 470.
Indicates that the FCC Form 470 is for the entire state.
Indicates if there are state or local procurement or competitive bidding requirements that apply to the applicant’s procurement of services.
Indicates if there are state or local procurement or competitive bidding requirements that apply to the procurement of services sought by the applicant.
Indicates whether a Request for Proposal (RFP) document was provided for the services requested.
Maximum number of years over which the applicant will amortize the costs.
Minimum number of years over which the applicant will amortize the costs.
Applicant phone number.
Applicant phone number extension.
Number of entities eligible for the services requested through an FCC Form 470.
Name of the main contact provided by the applicant on the FCC Form 470.
Street address line 1 for the application’s main contact.
Street address line 2 for the application’s main contact.
Applicant can choose to use an installment payment plan for the non-discounted portion of any special construction charges associated with the request.
City of the application’s main contact.
State of the application’s main contact.
Zip code of the application’s main contact.
Zip code extension of the application’s main contact.
Phone number of the application’s main contact.
Phone number extension of the application’s main contact.
Email address of the main contact. This contact is used as the first point of contact through the funding request process.
Name of the technical contact provided by the applicant of the FCC Form 470.
Title of the technical contact provided by the applicant on the FCC Form 470.
Description of Category Two services (Internal Connections, Basic Maintenance of Internal Connections, or Managed Internal Broadband Services) the applicant seeks discounts for.
Phone number of the technical contact provided by the applicant on the FCC Form 470.
Description of Category One services (Internet Access and/or Telecommunications) the applicant seeks discounts for.
Phone extension of the technical contact provided by the applicant of the FCC Form 470.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset contains information from the basic information section of each FCC Form 470, including applicant details such as contact information, application number, Billed Entity Number (BEN), and funding year, and related information from the E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC).  Use this dataset to answer questions such as: What is the contact information of the applicant? Who is the technical contact for the applicant? When was the applicant’s FCC Form 470 certified? All data contained within the Basic Information (FCC Form 470) dataset is self-reported by applicants.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 -100%. Any value less than 100% indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

resource.name: E-Rate Request for Discount on Services: FRN Status (FCC Form 471 and Related Information)
resource.description: This dataset contains information about the Funding Request Number (FRN) listed within each FCC Form 471 and related information from the E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC).
columns_name: FRN Total Monthly Recurring Ineligible Costs
FRN Total Pre-Discount Eligible Recurring Cost
FRN Total Monthly Recurring Eligible Costs
FRN Total Pre-Discount Eligible One-Time Costs
FCDL Comment for FCC Form 471 Application
Award based on State Master Contract
columns_description: Indicates if an FCC Form 473 Service Provider Annual Certification (SPAC) was filed for the Funding Year associated with the FCC Form 471.
Billing account number for the billed entity.
Indicates whether an FCC Form 470 was posted for the services/products associated with the FRN.
Status of the funding request. It includes pending, funded, denied or cancelled.

Indicates whether the form version of the application is "current" or "original." It can be used to aggregate the data between current and original applications. "Current" is the view of the form processed by USAC. "Original" is the view of the form originally submitted by the applicant upon certification.
Explanation of RFCDL decision at the form level.
Indicates whether FRN is for leased dark fiber or IRU (Indefensible Right of Use).
Reference to a local law or contract to support pricing confidentiality requests.

Funding source when the applicant is seeking a state match for fiber FRNs.  The E-rate program will provide additional Category One funding (up to 10%) to match state funding for special construction to connect schools and libraries to high-speed broadband services that meet the FCC's long-term capacity broadband goals.
Applicant's organization type.
Annual Interest Rate Associated with a Fiber Application.
Invoicing may begin for the FRN as there is an approved FCC Form 486.
Program provides 1 to 1 dollar match amount in extra Category One fiber special construction funding up to an additional ten percent discount.
The total amount for the Funding Request (FRN) after discount.
Discount rate applied to service or equipment for the FRN.
Number of months a service is provided during a funding year for an FRN based on the service start date and end date.
Indicates whether the FRN pricing must be kept confidential and not disclosed to the public.
Service provider name for the FRN.
Services must be installed or product must be delivered on or before this date.
The date the contract was awarded by the applicant to service provider.
Contract number for the FRN. It can used to filter records related to a specific contract number.
Email Address of the main contact provided by the applicant on the FCC Form 471.
Applicant's state.
Applicant organization name.
Unique funding request number associated with the FCC Form 471.
FCC Form 470 application number for the FRN submitted in EPC (FY2016 and later).

Contract expiration date for the FRN. If the FRN is for a tariff or month-to-month service this field displays the service end date. This field can be used to filter the 471 applications that have active contracts.

Total pre-discount ineligible monthly recurring charges of a funding request. This field can be aggregated at an FRN level to generate metrics across service type or entities. This field should not be used to generate metrics at FRN line Item level.
Total pre-discounted eligible recurring charges of a funding request. It is derived by multiplying the month of service and the pre-discounted monthly recurring charges.

Total one-time/non-recurring charge of a funding request. This field can be aggregated at an FRN level to generate metrics across service type or entities. This field should not be used to generate metrics at FRN line Item level.

Total pre-discount eligible monthly recurring charges of a funding request. This field can be aggregated at an FRN level to generate metrics across service type or entities. This field should not be used to generate metrics at FRN line Item level.
FRN service type including voice, data transmission and/or Internet access, basic maintenance of internal connections, internal connections, or managed internal broadband services.
Balance due payment made at the end of the financing period for fiber installation.
Unique application number is generated at the time an applicant begins to file FCC Form 471. Applicants can request funding for multiple services under the same application number.
Unique number assigned to the billed entity/ applicant.
A unique nine-digit number assigned to identify the service provider.
Number of months left on the contract for the FRN.
Date the applicant FCDL was revised
Funding year for the application.
FCC Form 470 application number for the FRN submitted in the legacy system (FY2015 and earlier).
Narrative for the FRN describing the products and services.
Total ineligible one-time costs for the FRN level.
Total pre-discount eligible non-recurring/one-time charges of a funding request.
Service start date from the approved FCC Form 486. Further updates to the service start date are not reflected in this field.
Unique # assigned to the FCC Form 486
Explanation of FCDL decision at the form level. MR: management reason; CR: cancelled reason; DR: denial reason.
The date of the wave that a funding commitment was issued in.
Indicates whether the contract for the FRN is based on a state master contract.
Type of restriction that enable applicants to make pricing information confidential such as State Law or Statute, Local Rule, Court Order, Contract Executed with Restrictive Terms.
Average cost of cabling, infrastructure, and associated hardware divided by the total project plant route feet.

Nickname given to an FRN by an applicant when filling their FCC Form 471.
Indicates whether the contact has voluntary extensions that can be exercised by the applicant for the FRN.

Total pre-discount monthly recurring charges of a funding request. This field can be aggregated at an FRN level to generate metrics across service type, status or entities. This field should not be used to generate metrics at FRN line item level.

Total pre-discount charges of a funding request. This field can be aggregated at an FRN level to generate metrics across service type or entities. This field should not be used to generate metrics at FRN line Item level.
Indicates whether the application has been certified in the window.

reason; DR: denial reason.
Contract type for the FRN including Month-to-Month, Contract or Tariff.

Type of invoice to be processed for FRN (SPI: Service Provider Invoice – FCC Form 474, BEAR: Billed Entity Applicant Reimbursement Form – FCC Form 472, or NOT SET (when no form has been received yet for the FY and therefore no invoicing mode has been set).
Total distance between a demark point at an applicant’s location and a service provider’s switching facility or point of presence measured in feet.
Remaining number of contract extensions for the FRN.
Fiber subtypes for fiber FRNs.  Options include maintenance and operation, network equipment, network equipment and maintenance, or special construction.
A number that indicates which wave sequence the funding commitment was issued in.
Indicates the review status of the Funding request. Pending Reason is limited to Current (Committed) forms.
Percentage of discount that is matched by USAC for fiber FRNs under the state matching provision.
Fiber type for fiber FRNs including Lit Fiber, Dark Fiber, or Self Provisioned Fiber.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset contains information about the Funding Request Number (FRN) listed within each FCC Form 471 and related information from the E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC). Use this dataset to answer questions about the individual service type, the quantity of the service requested, which service provider is supplying the service, the length of the contract, the discount of the services received and fiber type information if applicable. All data contained within the FRN information data collection (FCC Form 471) is self-reported by applicants to the E-rate Program.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 -100%. Any value less than 100% indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

resource.name: High Cost: Connect America Fund Broadband Map (CAF Map)
resource.description:
This dataset serves as the foundation for the Connect America Fund Broadband Map (CAF Map), an interactive online map that shows the impact of the Connect America Fund (CAF) on broadband expansion to close the digital divide in rural America. The CAF Map displays the geographic areas that are eligible for CAF support, as well as the specific fixed locations where carriers participating in the program have built out mass-market, high-speed Internet service. The dataset includes address, latitude and longitude coordinates, carrier name, deployment year and minimum speeds offered for every location where CAF-supported service is available. 

The information in this dataset comes directly from carriers, which submit broadband deployment data annually through USAC’s High Cost Universal Broadband (HUBB) portal showing where they have built out service using CAF funding. The current CAF Map is based on data certified in the HUBB as of March 10, 2023, to reflect broadband deployment through Dec. 31, 2022. USAC independently verifies deployment to a random sample of locations reported in the HUBB each year to monitor carrier compliance with CAF build-out obligations.
columns_description: Company name of the affiliated carrier, or in its absence, carrier name.
Individual High Cost fund under which the carrier deployed. See High Cost Funds Glossary for details.
Broadband speed that meets the required minimum standard (varies by fund).
This field is mandatory if a carrier selects “other technology” (option 7) from the list in the Technology field.
Unique number assigned to each ETC based on its service area. A carrier with multiple service areas within a single state will have multiple SAC.
CAF II Auction and RDOF carriers must report the type of technology used to deliver broadband service for all locations served. (This field is optional for carriers in other funds).
Longitude of the deployment location.

CAF II Auction, Alaska Plan and RDOF carriers must report whether they provide low-latency broadband service (as indicated by a 2) or high-latency broadband service (as indicated by a 1). (This field is optional for carriers in other funds).
Percent of locations a carrier is required to deploy based on current program year milestone. For RBE the obligations are at SAC level and the deadline dates are not same as filing year end dates.
Amount of funding disbursed to carriers by state.
City of the deployment location.
State of the deployment location.
Zip Code of the deployment location.
Date the deployment occurred.
Year the deployment occurred.
Census block of the deployment location.
Number of locations the carrier is obligated to deploy to for the whole fund.
Number of household being served within a location.
Date by which carriers must certify their deployments for that filing year in order to meet their milestone requirement.
Address of the deployment location.
Latitude of the deployment location.
Standard name used to identify a study area. Typically, the carrier name is the same as the company name.

domain_tags: connect america fund broadband loop support

domain_metadata.value: This dataset serves as the foundation for the Connect America Fund Broadband Map (CAF Map), which displays the geographic areas eligible for CAF support, as well as the specific fixed locations where carriers participating in the program have built out broadband service. The information in the CAF Map comes directly from carriers, which submit broadband deployment data annually through USAC’s High Cost Universal Broadband (HUBB) portal. The current CAF Map is based on data certified in the HUBB as of March 10, 2023, to reflect broadband deployment through Dec. 31, 2022. USAC independently verifies deployment to a random sample of reported locations each year to monitor carrier compliance with CAF build-out obligations, but not all data in the map has been subject to this review.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 to 100 percent. Any value less than 100 percent indicates a field with missing values.

resource.name: Lifeline Disbursements
resource.description: This dataset provides information on total support dollars disbursed and total subscribers claimed by Eligible Telecommunication Carriers (ETCs) within the Lifeline Program by month and year since January 2018. This dataset displays an ETC’s Study Area Code (SAC) but does not include the Service Provider Identification Number (SPIN). If a search needs to be performed by SPIN, please refer to the legacy Funding Disbursement Search Tool, which includes all total support dollars disbursed and total subscribers claimed from 2004 to the present. If searching by "SPIN Name," please refer to the FCC Filings and use the most recent appendix to find the proper name.
columns_description: Indicates whether the funds were disbursed from the Lifeline, Linkup or Toll Limitation Services (TLS) program.
Indicates whether the submission was a claim or an adjustment.
Amount of funding disbursed to carrier.
Indicates whether the carrier’s technology is wireline or wireless.
Indicates whether the support type was given to a tribal or non-tribal area.
Year of disbursement to carrier.
Standard name used to identify a study area. Typically, the study area name is the same as the carrier name.
Unique six-digit number assigned to each Eligible Telecommunications Carrier (ETC) based on its service area
State abbreviation for carrier receiving Lifeline support.
Number of subscribers being claimed.
Indicates whether the carrier is an incumbent local exchange carrier (ILEC) or a competitive eligible telecommunications carrier (CETC).
The "Data Month" field on FCC Form 497 or the Lifeline Claims System.
Year of the "Data Month" field on FCC Form 497 or the Lifeline Claims System.
Year and month of disbursement to carrier in MM/DD/YYYY format.
Month of the "Data Month" field on FCC Form 497 or the Lifeline Claims System.
Indicates whether the service was voice, broadband, or bundled.
Month of disbursement to carrier.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset provides information on total support dollars disbursed and total subscribers claimed by Eligible Telecommunication Carriers (ETCs) within the Lifeline Program by month and year since January 2018.

resource.name: E-Rate Request for Discount on Services: Recipients Of Service (FCC Form 471 and Related Information)
resource.description: This dataset contains information about the entities who receive the service and associated cost allocations included within each FCC Form 471, and related information from the E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC).
columns_description: Funding request line item number.
Unique billed entity number associated with the entity name on the FCC Form 471.
Recipient's organization name.
Unique application number generated at the time applicants begin to file the FCC Form 471. Applicants can request funding for multiple services under the same application number.
Email address of the main contact listed in the FCC Form 471 application.
Unique funding request number (FRN) associated with the FCC Form 471.
State of the applicant.
Name of the billed entity.
Entity number for the recipient of service.
Indicates whether the application has been certified during the FCC Form 471 application filing window.
Funding year for the FCC Form 471.
Field indicates whether the form version of the application is "current" or "original."
Cost allocation for the recipient of service for Category Two products and services.
Number of lines allocated to a recipient of service for Category One services.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset contains information about the entities who receive the service and associated cost allocations included within each FCC Form 471, and related information from the E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC). Use this dataset to answer questions such as: Which entities use E-rate funds for their connectivity services? What are the associated cost allocations included within each FCC Form 471? All information within the Recipients of Service (FCC Form 471) dataset is self-reported by applicants.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 -100%. Any value less than 100% indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

resource.name: E-Rate Request for Discount on Services: Discount Calculations (FCC Form 471 and Related Information)
resource.description: This dataset contains information about the discount calculations included within each FCC Form 471 and related information from the E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC).
columns_name: Child's Entity Community Eligibility Program Percentage
Child's Entity Federal State Cooperative System Code

columns_description: Square footage of a library.
Code assigned by the Institute of Museum and Library Services (ILMS) based on the population served by a library or library system.
Percentage of students in the child entity that are eligible for Community Eligibility Program (CEP).
Federal-State Cooperative System (FSCS) code for a public library child entity.
State's Local Education Association (LEA) number assigned to a school, that is a parent entity.
Code assigned by the Institute of Museum and Library Services (ILMS) based on the population served by a library.
Number of fulltime students for a parent entity.
Percentage of students in the parent entity that are eligible for Community Eligibility Program (CEP).
Name of child's entity.
Dollar amount of the endowment for the child entity.
Applicant state.
Alternative discount mechanism used to determine the percentage of National School Lunch Program (NSLP) for the parent entity (e.g. Survey, sibling match, combination (not CEP) or none).
Form version: original or current.
Child entity type such as school, library or non-instructional facility (NIF).
Indicates whether the child student count is based on an estimate.
Alternative discount mechanism used to determine the percentage of National School Lunch Program (NSLP) for the child entity e.g. Survey, sibling match, combination (not CEP) or none.
Indicates whether the selected parent entity's school or library resides in a rural or urban area.
Funding year for the application.
School number assigned by the state to a school.
Indicates whether the parent’s entity student count is based on an estimate.
Indicates whether the selected entity type for a parent entity is school, library or non-instructional facility (NIF).
Indicates whether the application has been certified in the window.
Indicates whether the selected child entity's school or library resides in a rural or urban area.
School code assigned by the National Center for Education Statistics (NCES) for a child entity.
School district name if the library is designated as the main branch.
Number of fulltime students for a child entity.

Discount rate applied to Category Two services for the applicant on the FCC Form 471 application. Services discounted by this rate include Internal Connections, Managed Internal Broadband Services (MIBS) and/or Basic Maintenance of Internal Connections.
School district name for the library system or library based on the location of the main branch.
Entity number for the child entity.
Number of students eligible for National School Lunch Program (NSLP) for a child school.

Annex name associated with the parent entity. An annex is a classroom or facility that is part of a school or library which is geographically separate but maintained through the same entity and considered part of that entity by the state.
Subtypes for a parent entity such as charter school, public school, pre-k etc.
State's Local Education Association (LEA) number assigned to a school.
Calculated by dividing the National School Lunch Program (NSLP) students by the total number of students for a school.
Subtypes for a child entity such as charter school, public school, pre-K etc.
Federal-State Cooperative System (FSCS) code for a public library, that is a parent entity.

Discount rate applied to Voice services for the applicant on the FCC Form 471 Application. This Category One discount is separate from the discount applied to Data Transmission and/or Internet Access Service.
Parent entity name.
School district number for the library system or library based on the location of the main branch.
Dollar amount of the endowment for the parent entity.

Discount rate applied to Category One services for the applicant on the FCC Form 471 application. Services discounted by this rate include Internet Access Services and / or Data Transmission but do not include Voice Services.

Annex name associated with the school or library for the child entity. An annex is a classroom or facility that is part of a school or library which is geographically separate but  maintained through the same entity and considered part of that entity by the state.
Billed entity number for applicant.
Unique application number is generated at the time an applicant begins to file FCC Form 471. Applicants can request funding for multiple services under the same application number.
Square footage of a library.
School number assigned by the state to a school or school district.
School code assigned by the National Center for Education Statistics (NCES) for a parent entity.
School district number if the library is designated as the main branch.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset contains information about the discount calculations included within each FCC Form 471 and related information from the E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC). Use this dataset to answer questions like: What are the schools and their student count that determine an FRN’s discount rate? Which entities are rural? Which school district is used to calculate the discount rate for each library? All data contained within the Discount Calculations (FCC Form 471) dataset is self-reported by applicants to the E-rate Program.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 to 100 percent. Any value less than 100 percent indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

resource.name: High Cost Disbursements
resource.description: This dataset provides information about total dollars disbursed to Eligible Telecommunication Carriers (ETCs) within the High Cost Program by month and year since January 2003.
columns_description: State abbreviation for carrier receiving High Cost support.
Individual High Cost fund in which the carrier participates. See High Cost Funds Glossary for details.
FCC Form 498 ID (also called a Service Provider Identification Number or SPIN) is a unique nine-digit number assigned to a service provider by USAC when the service provider files an FCC Form 498.
Unique number assigned to each ETC based on its service area. A carrier with multiple service areas within a single state will have multiple SAC.
Standard name used to identify a study area. Typically, the study area name is the same as the carrier name.
Month of disbursement to carrier.
Amount of funding disbursed to carriers. The “amount disbursed” may occasionally show a negative number. This is a result of prior period adjustments, audit recoveries, or other factors.
Year of disbursement to carrier.

connect america fund phase ii auction

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 to 100 percent. Any value less than 100 percent indicates a field with missing values.

resource.name: E-Rate Request for Discount on Services: Consultants (FCC Form 471 and Related Information)
resource.description: This dataset contains information about the consulting firms listed within each FCC Form 471, including their name and contact information, as well as related information from the E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC).
columns_description: Consulting firm email address.

Applicant state.
Unique application number is generated at the time an applicant begins to file FCC Form 471. Applicants can request funding for multiple services under the same application number.
Contact phone for consulting firm or individual consultant.
State for consulting firm or individual consultant.
Name of consulting firm or individual consultant.

Indicates whether the form version of the application is "current" or "original." It can be used to aggregate the data between current and original applications. "Current" is the view of the form processed by USAC. "Original" is the view of the form originally submitted by the applicant upon certification.
Unique number assigned to the billed entity/ applicant.
Indicates whether the application has been certified in the window.
Funding year for the application.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset contains information about the consulting firms listed within each FCC Form 471, including their name and contact information, as well as related information from the E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC). All data contained within the Consultants data collection (FCC Form 471) is self-reported by applicants to the E-rate Program.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 -100%. Any value less than 100% indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

resource.name: E-Rate Request for Discount on Services: Connectivity Information (FCC Form 471 and Related Information)
resource.description: This collection contains connectivity data about the Funding Request Number (FRN) listed within each FCC Form 471, including service type, contract information, service provider data, and cost for the service, as well as related information from the E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC).

"Current" is the view of the form processed by USAC. "Original" is the view of the form originally submitted by the applicant upon certification.

Unique application number is generated at the time an applicant begins to file FCC Form 471. Applicants can request funding for multiple services under the same application number.

Connectivity barriers for a robust network for a parent entity (e.g. Equipment too costly, Outdated equipment, Physical structure or layout of building etc.).

Connectivity barriers for a robust network for a child entity e.g. Equipment too costly, Outdated equipment, Physical structure or layout of building etc.

domain_metadata.value: This collection contains connectivity data about the Funding Request Number (FRN) listed within each FCC Form 471, including service type, contract information, service provider data, and cost for the service, as well as related information from the E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC). Use this dataset to answer questions such as: What are the individual service types? What quantity of service did the applicant request? Which service provider is supplying service and what is the length of the contract? What discount did the applicant receive on services? Did the applicant request funding for fiber? All information within the Connectivity Information (FCC Form 471) dataset is self-reported by applicants.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 -100%. Any value less than 100% indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.
